rComments: Professor Lopez was a funny, charismatic, and approachable lecturer who could make Shakespeare appealing to anyone. Plus there's an option to write no essays (if you take an extra test)! I would recommend his classes to anyone. It
Super funny and interesting lecturer, went above and beyond conventional Shakespearean analysis and did really interests analysis through visual and political commentary lenses.
Good prof, good ideas, hard to keep up with sometimes. Helpful guy though and generates enthusiasm, Tests not representative of any in class questions, could be vague and grading criteria subjective
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Respected']

rComments: The workload is heavy and he's a bit of a tough grader, but the feedback he provides on both your ideas and the actual quality of your writing is far more helpful than the average English instructor. His lectures are also consistently engaging, funny, and insightful, and he's always willing to help you out, either in person or over email.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Gives good feedback', 'Participation matters']

rComments: Having taken a course with Professor Lopez before, he is still very interested in challenging one's creativity when investigating Renaissance Drama. His lectures are fine, though the content can be a bit much to take in at times. I definitely recommend taking any courses you can with Professor Lopez.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Get ready to read', 'Participation matters']

rComments: Professor Lopez was amazing! His lectures always revolved around specific things and he'd just branch out from there expertly. He made my Monday mornings worth it!

Professor Lopez was a pleasure to have teaching material that can at times be intimidating. His lectures on Shakespeare was based heavily on visuals, and he challenged the class to do a visual reading of a play at the end of the year, which he was really very open about! Highly appreciates creativity as a means of teaching and learning!
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Hilarious']

rComments: Lopez is an amazing prof. He is passionate about what he teaches (I took his Shakespeare course) and has great focus and challenges your writing style and essay structure. Also, he makes entire lectures about sex. He's hilarious, clear cut, interesting, but BRUTAL about deadlines. If it's late, it's a ZERO. Tutorials are a MUST.
Professor Lopez is a great lecturer and he is very knowledgeable. See him in office hours to discuss what you are working on.

I took the full year shakespeare course and barely went to class. ended up with a 70. the lectures that i did go to were very entertaining. he's really funny and witty, he's definitely not a boring lecturer. however, the lectures were definitely too long.

Best lecturer I've seen at U of T; he's clear, funny, and makes Shakespeare interesting. However, he was very quick to anger (don't talktextbrowse the Webfall asleep)--HE WILL CALL YOU OUT. I found his marking tough and his expectations unclear. Extremely arrogant and self-centred.  He expects you to read 14 plays: 4 in 1st term, 10 in 2nd term.

Although a little harsh when it comes to electronic use in class, Professor Lopez's lectures are super interesting and really make you approach Shakespeare- and reading in general- with a mindset of literary analysis.
Boring, tardy, unclear and verbose
really boring.... no will to come to class
Extremely boring. You will hate your life for the hour during which he speaks
His lectures are really boring :c
Worth going to class just for his crazy antics and lines of thought.  Not the most helpful, nor certainly the easiest prof, but fun to have.

I would recommend any course that Professor Lopez teaches. He is a fantastic professor, and actively engaged in making sure his students engage with the material, and preform to the best of their abilities. I would take this course again 5 more times if I could.

Professor Lopez was hilarious. I was always excited to attend class because his personality filled the lecture with more than simply reading. He was easily irritated as well as sarcastic but entirely hilarious
He is s enthusiastic, witty, articulate and just one of the best professors I've ever had. He makes me excited to go to class.

When I took Narrative, easiness was based on your TA, but Prof. Lopez was still great. He bumped you by 1% just for visiting him at office hours. Anyhow, he taught us a great range of books from different genres and eras and gave plenty of insight to each. All of his lectures were interesting and well-delivered. He made me an English specialist.

By far the best professor I have ever had. He is absolutely hilarious and brilliant, his lectures are exciting, funny and intriguing. The books in ENG110 are awesome as well, I would most definitely recommend taking a class with him.

When Professor Lopez paused the class to explain that there was a man outside "swirling in the snow as if in a pastoral dream," I knew I had stumbled across a gem.  He's easily irritated, and it's quite hilarious.
Professor Lopez's course made me an English major. :)
He was one of the best profs i have ever had at u of t. Very concise, and witty and hilarious, while clearly passionate about what he teaches. I would recommend the class to friends.

Rather wonderful. Funny and thoughtful and kind. I would definitely take another course from this prof if I were given the chance. His close reading assignments were difficult and he was hard to please and very thorough.
This class was totally worth it...even if i did really bad. Prof Lopez rocked my world. Like a sexy Steve Carrell.
Two thumbs up
So wonderful.
i love him. and his golden tie.
He is so hilarious and awesome.
Very Cool, nothing negative about his personality or his lectures. Brilliant, funny, creative, inspiring.
reminds me of Ben Stiller. Not gonna lie. And it kills me how he gets angry at cell phones going off in class, hahahh. Funny bro.
good teacher!
Love him.

I LOVED Prof Lopez! I thought he was very captivating and creative. His classes never ceased to amaze me. He even analyzed a "cosmopolitan" mag for one of his classes. He is understanding of busy student schedules, and if he could have it his way he wouldn't give any exams at all. Reminds me of Steve Carrel (in personality and appearance) :)

Lopez was one of the best lecturers I've had this year. He made it worth it to come to class, even when it was my only one that day. He was very organized and presented information in a very clear and concise manner. The work he assigned was challenging but still reasonable. I loved him! <3
Best Prof ever! VERY clear, EXTREMELY organized, funny, makes the course interesting, makes you WANT to attend every class.

Absolutely adorable, entertaining lectures, reasonable assignments. I have a little bit of a crush on this man. He can get a bit overdetailed and stuff but he's generally quite amusing and a worthwhile professor. Definitely one of my favourites.
Brilliant! Love this guy. I think people are just intimidated. He's definitely a piece of work, but in a good way.

Can be arrogant at times, sometimes tries to be "too" funny/entertaining that it just becomes trite. I did not like the mandatory tutorials and tutorial responses that had to be written up (1 page each week) on top of the "unique" question/comment that we had to come up with for every lecture. Nonetheless, he is an interesting lecturer.

I have to laugh at all these negative comments! I really liked Prof. Lopez. Yeah, you can't slack off or not come to class, but seriously if you don't want to take the class, DON'T. Don't be a whiny baby about it. If you want to learn something and be challenged, take his class. If not, go take another professor who's easier.

Hated this prof so much. Very slimy attitude; not funny at all, very annoying personality.  Constantly brags about magazine articles he writes for Shakespeare Quarterly - um it's not that special.  Gives zero marks for creative essay topics, just wants you to kiss his ass. don't take his class - terrible prof.

Very stuck up, Ivory Tower type. Taught a 200 level course as though it was a 4th year seminar. Complains about rival professors and students. Hated this class because of him. Huge egomaniac: a 'bonus assignment' involved paying to go see a production of a play HE put on. Avoid like the plague, unless you are a shallow type who likes 'hot' profs.

Really great prof! Comes off a bit arrogant at first, but he's interesting, smart, and funny. If you want to do well, though, go talk to him in office hours! He'll make an effort to really help you out. Also, very cute!
Read lectue from premade notes. Not extremely clear or helpful with essay writting and goals he wishes students to meet.
totally brilliant, but extremely full of himself..more so than any other prof I've had. The effect was kind of slimy.
No Comments
No Comments
Lopez is the most amazing professor in the English dept. Not only are his lectures totally brilliant, but he's REALLY attractive. That probably shouldn't count, but it kept me from missing class ;)

Enthusiastic, clear, concise, interesting, passionate about the material, and one of the smartest profs I've ever met. He's also very helpful. His essay topics are interesting. However, he is a tough marker and you're gonna have to work hard for an A. You might not get a high mark, but you'll learn a lot and improve your writing.

A great addition to the department. He's real cool b/c he can be both aloof and intense in conveying sharp and brilliant insights. He is concerned with making sure that you get a quality degree, always made time for students; his passion radiates.

BEST PROF AT U OF T!!!! His lectures are totally brilliant. He really looks closely at the text and has a great sense of humour to boot!  Very helpful and friendly as well to talk to. He really CARES about the students.

Prof. Lopez is amazing.  He really got me interested in Shakespeare (Partly because he's not bad to look at so skipping class was OUT of the question!) Overall, a great teacher with much passion for his field.

Not a bad guy at all. Very quick and ironic sense of humour that jabs at the Shakespeare academic community among much else (our modern deification of Shakespeare). His analysis is at times dry and even mundane; he could focus more the on the meta-issues of literature (philosophical, symbolic). A move from micro to macro analaysis would be great.
totally hilarious and extremely interesting. some of the closest/ most impressive readings of syntax that i've ever seen! He's also abit of a total babe as well.
